ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Coding with Python and R to design Psychology Experiments, running subjects for those experiments, handling the machines needed for the experiment, learning data analysis and thinking like a scientist.

I learned more research, analysis, and cognitive skills in this course more than any of my other courses - I not only learned a lot about cognition of animals but also about how to conduct research and scientific investigations in general.
I researched with the Leonard Learning Lab - my experience has been amazing! I learned R in weekly workshops, how to design and run developmental psychology experiments, and had a lot of freedom.

I gained fluent knowledge of GSR data and how to read it for legibility. I became far more familiar with research protocols and how research is funded and approved. Working in this lab felt as if it was really preparing me to work in similar research settings in the future. I'm excited about the relationship that I've started to build with this lab and sincerely look forward to continuing to work with my team.
This course allows you to conduct/ help in a research project in the psychology department. It gives the opportunity for hands on experience even prior to senior year
So much. Introduction to R, working closely with amazing people on current and future studies.

Was responsible for conducting studies with children 6-8 y/o observing qualities of childrens persistence, motivation, and learning. took part in weekly meetings evaluating L3s future research paths. helped create and design visual test stimuli used in studies with children day to day. analyzed data using R to observe correlations between specific test pedagogies and childrens learning experiences. developed skills pertaining to literature review and was able to grow immensely in how i hope to frame my future aspirations in the field of psych with the help of this lab's amazing mentors.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
It is good that you have your own advisor who you can turn to and who teaches you all you need to know.
This is different (and in my opinion better) than a regular class because everything is more flexible and tailored to your needs.
I think that this course was pretty flawless, however I do think even more meetings like lab meetings and peer group meetings could have been even more beneficial

I think that the lab that I was working with was amazing! I think that the course itself allows for significant flexibility in terms of how you conduct your work, so I feel as if I certainly was able to accommodate my work really well with this lab. The only thing that I would find fault in is that this can be an incredibly intimidating path to embark on, but I was incredibly lucky that my lab was super supportive and wanted to see me succeed as an assistant. I felt incredibly valued and so grateful to be in this lab.
Its always very good to have experience in research projects and this class was ideal for this purpose
Everyone is amazing. Weaknesses are that I didnt join the lab until now

had a great conversation during my last mentor meeting about this, so won't go into great detail but i just can't emphasize enough how much i appreciate how communication-oriented the LLL is! It has helped me become the best team member I can be and also given me incredible tools to use for personal and academic and professional growth.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes.

Yes because you learn insights into research first-hand, which you have no chance of getting in any regular class.
It is also tailored to your needs and knowledge, so if you know less or more, the teaching starts exactly where you need it.
Absolutely. This has been the best way for me to get familiar with research and working in a lab setting.

Absolutely! I think that this is so flexible that, honestly, the only thing I'd be able to discuss further in terms of the course is that it comes down to who you're doing research with at the end of the day.
Definitely yes if they are interested in research
Absolutely. Really helpful for anyone interested in cogsci/ psych and great exposure to other peoples research
yes! well, anyone who can take part in psych research // be an RA for LLL, absolutely should in my opinion
